resources.string: Enter an url in the filter field. Use a query string or something similar to replace the filter text with the url that is being forwarded. For example, you could create an url like http://example.com/?url=@url where @url will be replaced. In case filter url matches regex pattern, \\1 will in filter pattern will be replaced by group 1 in regex and automatically redirect. (regex: https://twitter.com/(.*) url: https://facebook.com/\\1). Multiple matches triggers first ordered by filter name(a before z)
No filters added!\n\nPress the + button to add some!
Are you sure you want to delete \"%1$s\"?
